--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, EmprzAnastazia@a... wrote:
> In a message dated 2/1/03 6:31:11 AM Central Standard Time, 
> cardhead649@y... writes:
>
> > OOC: Just as long as it's inside NBW limitations - ie 16 feet 
tall or 
> > less.
> 
> OOC: Not her old form.. her BM form is about that height, just a 
little 
> smaller.
> Her old form, the actual Gen 1 like form is 39.5 feet. 
> 
> IC:
> 
> > "Okey-dokey, I'll be right back."  Jackie heads to the hold and 
soon 
> > returns with a double-armload of parts.  He glances around for a 
> > suitable workstation and settles on a nearby table.  Putting his 
> > burden down nearby, he turns to Maxima.  "If you'll just lie down 
> > over here, we can get started."
> > 
> 
> She nodded, padding over to the table he indicated. Slid upon it & 
laid down, 
> just like she had done for millions of years for updates & repairs. 
Very use 
> to this. But she found it a little difficult to trust 
this 'Autobot' as she 
> called him, since he did remind her of the enemy she fought long 
ago. But,.. 
> he was her chance of restoring herself. Unless she took all the raw 
materials 
> & slipped away to the Ark. 
> 
> The ark. She found it hard to believe that no one knew where it 
was. Fools, 
> it's all in the records. even she knew where it was. She had been 
there a 
> couple times, long ago to destroy the Autobots, waging a 
confrontation at the 
> Ark. 
> 
> all the more that she had to get to the Ark to protect it. Not so 
much as for 
> the Autobots inside, but her comrades, the Decepticons. If anyone 
were to be 
> so foolish enough to attempt to destroy it, they would change all 
that was 
> now, all the future.

OOC: Uh, that's an issue for the council to decide.  There's a rule 
against making your chars too big.  Anyway, average G1 size is closer 
to 20 feet tall than 40.  You're talking about a character nearly the 
size of some gestalts.

"Okay, here goes ..."  Wheeljack reaches over and sedates her, then 
starts to work.  Installing new parts is generally time-consuming, 
but the Autobot makes relatively short work of it.  After a few hours 
of welding, digging, and installing the necessary subroutines for the 
transformation to work, he feels his patient is ready to face the 
world, and reactivates her.  "There you are.  How do you feel?"
